docs.snippet: One of the most remarkable events connected with our present war arrangements, is the uniform health of the troops, both at the recruiting stations and also at the various camps about Washington and the Mississippi River. Even when the soldiers have...
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most remarkable events connected with our present war arrangements, is the uniform health of the troops, both at the recruiting stations and also at the various camps about Washington and the Mississippi River. Even when the soldiers have slept for weeks in the open air, unsheltered by tent or roof, lying on the bare, often wet ground, there has been no disease engendered. The change of food, varieties ...

headline.main: OFF TO THE WAR.; ARRIVAL OF THE MASSACHUSETTS TWENTY-FIRST AND SEVENTEENTH REGI-MENTS. NEWS OF THE REBELLION. THE SEVENTEENTH REGIMENT.

docs.snippet: Our dispatches from Washington this morning disclose a bad condition of affairs among the rebels. According to information received by the Government, the leaders have commenced quarreling among themselves already, not content to wait until they have...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our dispatches from Washington this morning disclose a bad condition of affairs among the rebels. According to information received by the Government, the leaders have commenced quarreling among themselves already, not content to wait until they have overcome the Yankees, and quartered themselves in the marble palaces in Broadway.

headline.main: AFFAIRS ON THE UPPER POTOMAC.; GEN. BANKS STILL AT MONOCACY THE REBELS AT HARPER'S FERRY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The correspondent of the Associated Press, with Gen. BANKS, Division, writes as follows: So quietly was the withdrawal of Gen. BANKS main column effected that we in Harper's Ferry knew nothing of it until Sunday, when we were astonished by the appearance of about 100 of HENDERBON'S secession cavalry.
